TopicTitle: Annoying flickering orbital lines stops me from going to other planets

Articles.Content:
I have no idea whether this is a mod issue or a game issue, but i'm using mods so i'm making this post here.

This bug has been annoying me for ages now, and I am completely unable to plot interplanetary transfers via manoeuvres or blind. I've tried reinstalling the game, removing mods and whatnot, but no luck. Here's the video:

NOTE: No matter what i do, this always happens (only with intercepts)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4e-Aj-B42qc

Mod list:

http://imgur.com/a/jvsLB
I have this in 1.1.3 and I workaround it by right-clicking on one of the encounter triangles, which makes the info-text stay. This is caused by rounding limits in values.

What do you mean by 'encounter triangles'? Do you mean the '<planet> Encounter' marker?

1 minute ago, Gamel0rd1 said:

What do you mean by 'encounter triangles'? Do you mean the '<planet> Encounter' marker?

I mean lower triangle. Try right clicking on any object among the orbit line when you have orbital maneuver marker, you can pin its text. Similarly, I pin the target encounter 1&2 to see the distance, when I move lines.
Try planning closes flickering encounter and then correct when you are near.

Also the over-sensitive 1.1.3 SAS could be part of it, perhaps deactivating it solves it (haven't tried).
